bug.author: alexenos
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h3>What is the problem?</denchmark-h>
When trying to train with an ExternalEnv MultiAgent environment through the PolicyServerInput/PolicyClient interface. The following error occurs: <denchmark-code>Traceback (most recent call last): File "/home/dgarner/.local/share/virtualenvs/ray_bug-QUDZwH1p/lib/python3.6/site-packages/ray/rllib/env/policy_client.py", line 272, in run "server.".format(samples.count, samples.total())) AttributeError: 'MultiAgentBatch' object has no attribute 'total' </denchmark-code>
Ray version and other system information (Python version, TensorFlow version, OS): python==3.6.9 ray==1.0.1.post1 tensorflow==2.3.1 OS: Ubuntu 18.04 LTS <denchmark-h:h3>Reproduction (REQUIRED)</denchmark-h>
Based on the unity3d_[server|client].py example, the following scripts will reproduce the error. Run the server script with no arguments, and then the client script with no arguments in another terminal. <denchmark-code>python bug_server.py python bug_client.py </denchmark-code>
I have verified my script runs in a clean environment and reproduces the issue. I have verified the issue also occurs with the latest wheels.

comments.comment:
Here are the scripts with a .txt extension <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ray-project/ray/files/5661172/bug_client.txt>bug_client.txt</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/ray-project/ray/files/5661173/bug_server.txt>bug_server.txt</denchmark-link>
Looks like it was using a deprecated method .total instead of .agent_steps(). Do you mind submitting a fix?

Thanks for raising this <denchmark-link:https://github.com/alexenos>@alexenos</denchmark-link> ! This PR fixes the issue: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ray-project/ray/pull/12704>#12704</denchmark-link>
Closing this. Feel free to re-open should the fix not work for you.
